description:
Senior Full Stack AI Engineer with Entrepreneurial Mindset (m/w/d)

We're a small, focused team that values humble, practical builders. We're entrepreneurs ourselves, and we love creating new products with exciting and innovative technology. If you have a startup spirit, enjoy side projects, and want to see your work make a real impact, we'd love to connect.

Stack: TypeScript (React, Node) | Tailwind CSS | Next.JS | Vite | AI frameworks (LangChain, OpenAI, Google Vertex AI, Azure AI) | Analytics (Plausible, PostHog) | Supabase | Postgresql | Azure Cosmos DB | Vercel | Google Cloud

What you'll be doing:
- Leading projects from initial concept through to production-ready apps.
- Choosing and evaluating the best tech stack and tools for each project.
- Building front-end and back-end solutions primarily with TypeScript (React, Node, Tailwind).
- Integrating AI solutions using tools like LangChain, OpenAI, Google Vertex AI, and Azure AI.
- Setting up analytics and event-tracking (e.g., Mixpanel, PostHog).
- Validating technologies through practical, real-world testing.
- Collaborating closely with designers, researchers, and users to build truly useful products.
- Communicating directly with clients‚Äîasking insightful questions and clarifying goals.

What you'll bring:
- 4+ years of experience in full-stack development (React, Node, TypeScript).
- Experience taking the technical lead on at least one major project.
- An entrepreneurial mindset‚Äîyou enjoy turning ideas into working products.
- Comfort with ambiguity and an ability to work independently.
- Great communication skills and a collaborative spirit.
- A passion for learning and experimenting with new technologies.
- Big Bonus: previous experience or side projects involving AI.

description:
Full Stack Engineer

Perplexity is looking for an experienced Full Stack Engineer to build and ship AI-powered product features end to end across both the frontend and backend.

Stack: NextJS | TypeScript | React | Python | Kubernetes | AWS | Docker

Responsibilities:
- Partner closely with Search, AI, Design, and Product teams to ship experiments and rapidly iterate on insights.
- Drive the launch of new features, experiments, and campaigns in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
- Architect and implement systems that integrate new tools with existing pipelines and LLM - or agent-based evaluation frameworks.
- Build, refine, and maintain the core components that power Perplexity's frontend experience.

Qualifications:
- Strong programming skills and the ability to work effectively across the full stack
- Solid coding fundamentals and experience contributing to both frontend and backend systems
- Self-driven mindset with strong ownership and follow-through
- Passion for building high-quality products, rapid prototyping, experimentation, and creating accessible user experiences
- 4+ years of industry experience

description:
Senior Software Engineer, Product Engineering, EU

Details zum Jobangebot
Hi üëãüèæ I‚Äôm Abhik, Ashby's Co-Founder and VP of Engineering. We‚Äôre looking for an ambitious full-stack engineer who is laser-focused on solving customer problems and making the right long-term investments to solve them not only today but in our future features and products.

What Ashby gives you in return is the best of both early and growth-stage environments. The agency and no-nonsense of a seed startup: you write product specs, make product and design decisions, and build in an almost-no-meeting culture. While also the product-market fit and scale of a growth-stage startup: tens of thousands of daily users who depend on your software and eagerly await your next feature.

We have notable customers like Notion, Linear, Shopify, and Snowflake. Our growth and retention metrics are best-in-class among our peers: we have tens of millions in ARR, growing >100% year over year, very low churn, and many years of runway. We‚Äôll share more details once we meet.

About The Role And How We Work

Our engineering culture strives to recreate the environments where we did our best work as ICs ‚Äì where we had the ownership and agency to impact our users with creative and innovative software.

I started my career building software for artists in the Visual Effects industry. It was a formative experience for me as a software engineer because success relied on my ability to be a product manager and designer. I talked to artists to understand their needs. I came up with ideas. I did industry research, designed interfaces, and prototyped ideas. I watched artists use what I built and decided what to tackle in the next iteration. No daily stand-ups, no t-shirt sizing, no planning meetings.

About

At Ashby, we‚Äôre building an environment that is optimistic about what engineers can own and achieve. An environment that embraces innovative engineers, and, frankly, often stays out of their way. As a Product Engineer, you‚Äôll take ownership over a large portion of one of our products and own projects end-to-end (wearing hats traditionally worn by product and design). You‚Äôll research competitors, write product specs, make wireframes, and more.

Technology Stack

TypeScript (frontend & backend), React, GraphQL API, Node.js, Postgres, Redis.

description:
FixMyCity entwickelt digitale Werkzeuge f√ºr die nachhaltige Mobilit√§tsplanung. Wir unterst√ºtzen St√§dte und Kommunen auf dem Weg zur nachhaltigen Mobilit√§t mit Tools wie TILDA und Trassenscout.

description:
Frontend Engineer

Climatiq is a fast-growing startup embedding carbon intelligence into business decisions worldwide. Our platform‚Äîcombining the world's leading emissions database with sophisticated AI and calculation tools‚Äîhelps thousands of sustainability teams work faster and reduce emissions across corporate and product carbon footprints.

In this role, you will:
- Design, build, and maintain modern frontend features across our core web applications and interfaces
- Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend engineering to deliver intuitive, performant user experiences
- Take ownership of key frontend components and contribute to architectural decisions
- Develop and iterate on full-stack features, using TypeScript across the stack and Next.js on the frontend
- Shape the look, feel, and functionality of data-intensive tools that empower users to understand and reduce their emissions

Role Requirements:
- 5+ years of experience building frontend and full-stack applications, ideally in SaaS environments
- 3+ years of production experience with TypeScript and Next.js, building and maintaining full-featured web applications
- Proficiency in RESTful API integration, state management, and component-based UI architecture
- Strong working knowledge of PostgreSQL or similar databases
- Familiarity with Rust and/or AWS infrastructure is a plus
- Structured, outcome-oriented mindset with strong problem-solving and communication skills
- Self-driven and comfortable working autonomously in a distributed team setting

Tech Stack: TypeScript (React frontend, NextJS backend), Rust for Core API, PostgreSQL, Vercel and AWS, GitHub, Auth0, Datadog

Location: Berlin or Remote within +/- 2 hours of CET
